All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
CellularNoise
An INoise implementation that divides space up into cells, and has configurable ways to get values from cells.
CellularNoise.NoiseType
 
ColorSupport
Color handling code that is used internally to implement some methods in GdxRandom, but can also be used by user code.
Compatibility
Methods for converting floats to and from ints, as well as doubles to and from longs and ints.
ContinuousNoise
 
CyclicNoise
A periodic type of continuous noise that looks good when frequencies are low, and rather bad when frequencies are high.
Distributor
Different methods for distributing input long or double values from a given domain into specific distributions, such as the normal distribution.
EncryptedFileHandle
A basic way to encrypt a FileHandle using the Speck Cipher.
FoamNoise
A RawNoise type that produces more-natural, less-uniform noise.
GapShuffler<T>
Meant to take a fixed-size set of items and produce a shuffled stream of them such that an element is never chosen in quick succession; that is, there should always be a gap between the same item's occurrences.
GdxRandom
A superset of the functionality in Random, meant for random number generators that would be too bare-bones with just Random's methods.
GradientVectors
Stores arrays representing vectors on the unit hypersphere in 2D through 6D.
GwtIncompatible
An annotation for the GWT compiler that makes a piece of code ignored on GWT only.
HoneyNoise
An INoise implementation that combines and accentuates SimplexNoise and ValueNoise.
LineWobble
Provides 1D noise methods that can be queried at any point on a line to get a continuous random value.
LineWobble.BicubicWobbleNoise
 
LineWobble.SmoothWobbleNoise
 
LineWobble.SplineWobbleNoise
 
LineWobble.TrigWobbleNoise
 
LineWobble.WobbleNoise
 
MathSupport
Math code that is used internally to implement some methods in GdxRandom, but can also be used by user code.
OpenSimplex2FastNoise
K.jpg's OpenSimplex 2, faster variant.
OpenSimplex2SmoothNoise
K.jpg's OpenSimplex 2, faster variant.
PerlinNoise
"Classic" Perlin noise, written by Ken Perlin before he created Simplex Noise, with minor adjustments.
PerlueNoise
A mix of "Classic" Perlin noise, written by Ken Perlin before he created Simplex Noise, with value noise calculated at the same time.
PointHasher
A group of similar methods for getting hashes of points based on int coordinates in 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6 dimensions and an int for state.
PointSequence<V extends com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector<V>>
A parent type for infinite point sequences, such as Halton sequences and the R2 sequence.
PointSequence.Halton2
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector2 items, this produces Vector2 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 2D Halton Sequence.
PointSequence.Halton3
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector3 items, this produces Vector3 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 3D Halton Sequence.
PointSequence.Halton4
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector4 items, this produces Vector4 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 4D Halton Sequence.
PointSequence.Halton5
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector5 items, this produces Vector5 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 5D Halton Sequence.
PointSequence.Halton6
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector6 items, this produces Vector6 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using a 6D Halton Sequence.
PointSequence.R2
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector2 items, this produces Vector2 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R2 Sequence.
PointSequence.R3
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector3 items, this produces Vector3 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R3 Sequence.
PointSequence.R4
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector4 items, this produces Vector4 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R4 Sequence.
PointSequence.R5
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector5 items, this produces Vector5 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R5 Sequence.
PointSequence.R6
A very simple Iterator or Iterable over Vector6 items, this produces Vector6 points that won't overlap or be especially close to each other for a long time by using the R6 Sequence.
PoissonDiskDiscrete
An implementation of the Poisson Disk sampling algorithm on a discrete grid.
PoissonDiskSmooth
An implementation of the Poisson Disk sampling algorithm on a continuous plane.
RandomAce320
A random number generator with five 64-bit states; does not use multiplication, only add, subtract, XOR, and rotate operations.
RandomChop128
A random number generator that is optimized for performance on 32-bit machines and with Google Web Toolkit, this uses only add, bitwise-rotate, and XOR operations (no multiplication).
RandomDistinct64
A variant on Java 8's SplittableRandom algorithm, removing the splittable quality so this has one possible stream.
RandomXMX256
A random number generator that guarantees 4-dimensional equidistribution (except for the quartet with four zeroes in a row, every quartet of long results is produced exactly once over the period).
RawNoise
Defines the core operations to generate continuous noise with a specific algorithm, and declares what properties of noise are supported by that algorithm.
RawNoise.Serializer
Allows serializing RawNoise objects with RawNoise.Serializer.serialize(RawNoise) and deserializing them with RawNoise.Serializer.deserialize(String).
RawWobbleNoise
Defines the core operations to generate continuous noise with a specific algorithm, and declares what properties of noise are supported by that algorithm.
RotationSupport
This has tools for generating and applying matrix rotations, potentially in higher dimensions than the typical 2 or 3.
RoughMath
Fast approximations of math methods that reach roughly the right answer most of the time.
Scramblers
Static methods that can take any long as input and produce a very different, but deterministically chosen, number of some type.
SimplexNoise
Simplex noise functions, in 2D, 3D, 4D, 5D, and 6D.
SorbetNoise
A mix of CyclicNoise with SimplexNoise; much less periodic than CyclicNoise alone.
UniqueIdentifier
A substitute for the UUID class, since it isn't available on GWT.
UniqueIdentifier.Generator
The type used as a factory to produce UniqueIdentifiers that are actually unique for a given Generator.
ValueNoise
A RawNoise type that produces blocky noise from 1D to 7D.
Vector5
A 5D vector, with mutable float fields.
Vector6
A 6D vector, with mutable float fields.
WeightedTable
A form of probability table, this stores indices into some external Array or other ordered sequence and weights that determine how much to favor producing a given index.
